abstract: Now that Ziggo, the Dutch cable group, has conceded a willingness to sell to Liberty, its task is to get full value from a weak position.
snippet: Now that Ziggo, the Dutch cable group, has conceded a willingness to sell to Liberty, its task is to get full value from a weak position.
lead_paragraph: Ziggo has opened the door to Liberty Global, the media company controlled by John Malone. A few weeks after rebuffing an approach, the Dutch cable group has confirmed takeover talks with its larger rival. Any deal would be both big and logical, since Ziggo and a unit of Liberty, UPC, dominate the local market. And Liberty already owns a dominant stake in Ziggo. Now that Ziggo has conceded a willingness to sell to Liberty, the task is to get full value from a weak position.

headline.main: Ziggo Still Has Cards to Play in Liberty Global Talks
